intro: Lomaria decomposita, commonly known as the decomposing lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Lomaria decomposita is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to colonize disturbed or barren areas.
